title: Untitled element schema

propertyDescriptions.dataStream: Human readable name of collection of records coming from a data source.
propertyDescriptions.dataStreamIRI: Unique identifier of collection of records coming from a data source.
propertyDescriptions.datastreamScheme: The name of the scheme or authority used for the Data Stream Identifier.
propertyDescriptions.dataStreamSchemeIRI: The IRI of the scheme or authority used for the Data Stream Identifier.
propertyDescriptions.DataSource: Physical or conceptual entity that creates the data streams that make up the described dataset. The data source may or may not be associated with a fixed location; for example, a series of discrete sensors deployed over time to a single location may be considered a single data source in some systems.
propertyDescriptions.Variable: A single entity being measured or computed.

dataStream.title: dataStream schema
dataStream.schema:name: dataStream
dataStream.schema:description: Human readable name of collection of records coming from a data source.

dataStreamIRI.title: dataStreamIRI schema
dataStreamIRI.schema:name: dataStreamIRI
dataStreamIRI.schema:description: Unique identifier of collection of records coming from a data source.

datastreamScheme.title: datastreamScheme schema
datastreamScheme.schema:name: datastreamScheme
datastreamScheme.schema:description: The name of the scheme or authority used for the Data Stream Identifier.

dataStreamSchemeIRI.title: dataStreamSchemeIRI schema
dataStreamSchemeIRI.schema:name: dataStreamSchemeIRI
dataStreamSchemeIRI.schema:description: The IRI of the scheme or authority used for the Data Stream Identifier.

DataSource.title: Untitled element schema

propertyDescriptions.dataSource: Human readable name of data source from which the variable(s) come(s).
propertyDescriptions.dataSourceIRI: IRI describing the data source (e.g., PID of an instrument).
propertyDescriptions.dataSourceScheme: The name of the scheme or authority used for the Data Source Identifier.
propertyDescriptions.dataSourceSchemeIRI: The IRI of the scheme or authority used for the Data Source Identifier.

dataSource.title: dataSource schema
dataSource.schema:name: dataSource
dataSource.schema:description: Human readable name of data source from which the variable(s) come(s).

dataSourceIRI.title: dataSourceIRI schema
dataSourceIRI.schema:name: dataSourceIRI
dataSourceIRI.schema:description: IRI describing the data source (e.g., PID of an instrument).

dataSourceScheme.title: dataSourceScheme schema
dataSourceScheme.schema:name: dataSourceScheme
dataSourceScheme.schema:description: The name of the scheme or authority used for the Data Source Identifier.

dataSourceSchemeIRI.title: dataSourceSchemeIRI schema
dataSourceSchemeIRI.schema:name: dataSourceSchemeIRI
dataSourceSchemeIRI.schema:description: The IRI of the scheme or authority used for the Data Source Identifier.

DataSource.schema:name: DataSource
DataSource.schema:description: Physical or conceptual entity that creates the data streams that make up the described dataset. The data source may or may not be associated with a fixed location; for example, a series of discrete sensors deployed over time to a single location may be considered a single data source in some systems.

items.title: Untitled element schema

propertyDescriptions.variableScheme: The name of the scheme or authority used for the Variable Identifier.
propertyDescriptions.variableSchemeIRI: The IRI of the scheme or authority used for the Variable Identifier.

variableScheme.title: variableScheme schema
variableScheme.schema:name: variableScheme
variableScheme.schema:description: The name of the scheme or authority used for the Variable Identifier.

variableSchemeIRI.title: variableSchemeIRI schema
variableSchemeIRI.schema:name: variableSchemeIRI
variableSchemeIRI.schema:description: The IRI of the scheme or authority used for the Variable Identifier.

items.schema:name: Variable
items.schema:description: A single entity being measured or computed.

schema:name: DataStream
schema:description: A collection of one or more variable records originating from a single data source (e.g., sensor, process, or person). A data stream can grow over time.
